definition: prop/support (for weight)/rest (e.g. arm rest)/thanks to/to hold in one's hand/to support in one's palm/to give/to base/to commit/to set/torr (unit of pressure)
to trust/to entrust/to be entrusted with/to act as trustee
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: What he said is just to delay the time.
sentences.chinese: 他的托词只是缓兵之计。

sentences.english: I think this is what the Treasury Department says, that they are kinda busy with other things until then.
sentences.chinese: 想必财政部会托词说，他们到那时才有时间。

sentences.english: Such bureaucratic subterfuge works on a small scale.
sentences.chinese: 像这些官僚式的托词只影响了一小范围。

sentences.english: She had marshalled her thoughts and had a legitimate excuse ready.
sentences.chinese: 她已经整理好了自己的思路，准备了一个合理的托词。

sentences.english: But, of course, there is always “market sentiment” to fall back on.
sentences.chinese: 当然，人们总是可以把“市场情绪”当作托词。

sentences.english: In this context, random or revel is a kind of excuse.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的背景下，随机或随缘都是一种托词。

sentences.english: But when his angina suddenly attack, then tried to get medicine study.
sentences.chinese: 但这时他的心绞痛忽然发作，于是托词回书房取药。

sentences.english: I 'm sorry I didn't answer your letter - I can only plead forgetfulness.
sentences.chinese: 对不起没有给你回信，对此我只能以忘记作为托词。

sentences.english: He tried to explain away his lateness, but we didn't accept his excuse.
sentences.chinese: 他竭力为自己迟到辩解，但是，我们不相信他的托词。

definition: to use as an excuse/on the pretext/excuse/pretext
to muddle through/to fob sb off/to beat around the bush/to dodge
to make excuses/to give an excuse (for not doing something)
delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
to plead/to claim as an excuse
to deceive others and to deceive oneself/to believe one's own lies
polite phrase/conventional greetings/cliché/to try to worm facts out of sb
